required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Computer Delivered and Community Health Worker Supported Smoking Cessation Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Computer Delivered and Community Health Worker Supported Smoking Cessation Intervention for Hospitalized Persons With HIV

brief_summary.textblock: The prevalence of tobacco smoking is high among persons with HIV (PWH). The investigators are piloting a two session computer-delivered intervention (CBI) with linkage to a community health worker (CHW) among hospitalized PWH with tobacco use 1a) To determine feasibility and acceptability of delivering this intervention and 2a) To determine intervention effect on 1) readiness to quit smoking and confidence in ability to quit smoking 2) uptake of smoking cessation therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Intervention Feasibility as assessed by the Feasibility of Intervention Measure
primary_outcome.description: 4 item scale, maximum score of 20 with higher score indicating greater feasibility

primary_outcome.measure: Intervention Acceptability as assessed by the Acceptability of an Intervention Measure
primary_outcome.description: Noted as continuous score on 4 item scale, maximum value of 20 with higher score indicating greater acceptability

secondary_outcome.measure: Readiness to quit smoking as assessed by a Visual analog scale
secondary_outcome.description: Score of 10=Ready to Quit, Score of 1=Not ready to quit. Scale is from 1-10

secondary_outcome.measure: Continued use of nicotine replacement therapy 1 month post intervention

arm_group.description: 2 Session Computer Delivered Intervention with use of Nicotine Replacement Therapy and Community Health Worker Follow Up
Routine Tobacco Cessation Advice to Stop Smoking and Nicotine Replacement Therapy as offered by the inpatient team

intervention.description: 2 sessions of computer delivered counseling + nicotine replacement therapy and CHW follow up post hospitalization up to twice weekly for up to 8 weeks
Standard tobacco treatment care offered by the inpatient care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >=18,
- A patient admitted to the Johns Hopkins Hospital
- Smoked >100 cigarettes in their lifetime
- Current smoker
- English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindication to nicotine replacement therapy including unstable angina and acute coronary syndrome

patient_data.ipd_description: As this is a very small pilot, we will share de-identified data on request.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available 12 months after study completion
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Information will be shared on request. Requests can be made to the study PI who will then work with the data manager to compile a de-identified data set.
